Name: Statue of a Sitting Man
Description: The statue depicts a man wearing a wig with horizontal stripes on the front and vertical ones on the sides, a double row collar, and a short kilt. He is shown in the traditional sitting position still adopted by Egyptian peasants nowadays. His left leg is folded under his right leg and his right foot is flat on the ground. Both hands are on his knees. His features are unusual, especially the wide mouth and closed eyes.
